narration:
Let's take a look at the important details that we need to include in our personal and academic profiles.

First, let's start with the personal section. This is where we provide information about ourselves, so it's essential that it's accurate and up-to-date. We'll include our name, address - which might be different from our contact address if you're living away from home for university - telephone number, mobile number, and email.

Now, let's move on to the academic section. This is where we showcase our current course and qualifications. We need to indicate what qualification we're working towards, and list all the subjects we're currently studying in this year. It's also essential that we provide information about any project or dissertation work we're undertaking, whether it's individual or group-based.

When describing your project or dissertation, try to be concise but informative. Outline the main objectives of the work, and clearly indicate your contribution to the project. This is an opportunity to showcase your skills and expertise, so make sure you highlight what you've learned and achieved throughout the process.

Remember, this section should give a clear picture of your academic abilities and achievements, so take the time to get it right. By providing accurate and detailed information about yourself and your studies, you'll be able to present a strong profile that showcases your skills and potential.
